title: FAQ
desc: Everything you always wanted to know about PSH (Princes Street Hostel) but were afraid to ask!

textsBlock.question: Payments
textsBlock.answer: Payments are taken two days prior to arrival.

textsBlock.question: WiFi
textsBlock.answer: The WiFi works great and you can connect from every room in the hostel and in the lounge area where there are tables you can work from.

textsBlock.question: Lockers
textsBlock.answer: The room has lockable lockers and you can either buy a lock from us (£4) or bring your own!

textsBlock.question: Breakfasts
textsBlock.answer: We can offer Breakfast at £3.90 though we are not the ones cooking, it is the cafe downstairs. Breakfast consists of a barista style coffee/hot drink + a filled roll or pancakes. So far our guests are happy with it.

textsBlock.question: Our kitchen
textsBlock.answer: We have a kitchen with many cooking utensils, ovens and hobs, a microwave, etc. We don't provide a dinner service but you are welcome to cook something for yourself. We have free salt, spices, instant coffee, tea and sugar.

textsBlock.question: Laundry
textsBlock.answer: We do not provide a laundry service, however there is a laundrette 10 minutes walk away : Bendix Self Service

textsBlock.question: Can I have a lower bunk bed ?
textsBlock.answer: We have a first come first serve policy regarding bed allocation though we are sure we'll have a comfortable bed for you when you arrive.

textsBlock.question: Where can I park my car ?
textsBlock.answer: We are right in the town centre and there is no "good spot". The best is to download the app Ringgo, otherwise there is paid parking on Waterloo Place, St Andrews Square or George Square. From 6.30pm till 8.30am, on-street-parking is virtually free.

textsBlock.question: Is there a place to park my bike ?
textsBlock.answer: Yes, we have a secure place for your bike. However our hostel is at the top of a building so there are quite a few steps to get up to us.
